title: Formula For Angular Displacement
text: Use the angular displacement formula for constant angular acceleration: θ $$=$$ $$\omega_0 t$$ + 1/2*\alpha*t**2.

title: Calculate the Angular Displacement
text: As the initial angular velocity is $$0$$, what is $$\theta=80\frac{1}{2}\times{0.4}^2$$ in rad?

title: Convert Angular Displacement to Revolutions
text: Since $$2\pi$$ radians is one revolution, the number of revolutions N is: $$N=\frac{\theta}{2} \pi=\frac{6.4rad}{2} \pi=$$? (round to integer)
